Justification: To rule out any fractures or structural abnormalities due to the recent lifting incident.
To assess for any soft tissue injuries, disc herniation, or nerve compression, especially given the localized pain and history of heavy lifting.
To check for any signs of infection or inflammation, although the absence of systemic symptoms makes this less likely.
To evaluate kidney function and electrolyte levels, which can be relevant in the context of pain management.
To rule out any urinary tract issues that could be contributing to back pain, especially if there are any changes in bowel or bladder function.
